title: San Francisco Population and Demographic Census Data
description: A. SUMMARY This dataset contains population and demographic estimates and associated margins of error obtained and derived from the US Census. The data is presented over multiple years and geographies. The data is sourced primarily from the American Community Survey. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED The raw data is obtained from the census API. Some estimates as published as-is and some are derived. C. UPDATE PROCESS New estimates and years of data are appended to this dataset. To request additional census data for San Francisco, email support@datasf.org D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET The dataset is long and contains multiple estimates, years and geographies. To use this dataset, you can filter by the overall segment which contains information about the source, years, geography, demographic category and reporting segment. For census data used in specific reports, you can filter to the reporting segment. To use a subset of the data, you can create a filtered view. More information of how to filter data and create a view can be found here

columns.name: source
columns.description: Source of the census survey data, these include: 1-year or 5-year, aggregate-level ACS and public microdata

columns.name: num_years
columns.description: Number of years of data collection included in the estimate

columns.name: start_year
columns.description: First year of data collection

columns.name: end_year
columns.description: Last year of data collection

columns.name: derived
columns.description: Indicates whether the estimate and margin of error provided by the census (FALSE) or calculated from the census data (TRUE). For example, estimates for neighborhoods are calculated by summing census tracts and would be flagged as derived

columns.name: derived_details
columns.description: If derived, this field explains how the estimate was calculated

columns.name: geography
columns.description: Geographic area for the estimate

columns.name: geography_id_name
columns.description: Type of geographic identifier, typically geoid provided by the census

columns.name: geography_id
columns.description: Geography ID or name. This identifier can be used to join to other datasets

columns.name: geography_name
columns.description: Name of the particular geography, census tract name, neighborhood name, etc

columns.name: demographic_category
columns.description: Broad category for the demographic information

columns.name: demographic_category_label
columns.description: Detailed description of what groups are included or excluded in the demographic category

columns.name: min_age
columns.description: Minimum age of population included in the estimate

columns.name: max_age
columns.description: Maximum age of population included in the estimate. Age of 120 is set as the default upper limit

columns.name: unit
columns.description: Unit of measure for the estimate e.g. population size, median income, etc.

columns.name: estimate
columns.description: Numeric estimate

columns.name: se
columns.description: Standard error (SE) of the estimate

columns.name: moe
columns.description: Margin or error of the estimate with 90% confidence. More information: https://www.census.gov/content/dam/Census/programs-surveys/acs/guidance/training-presentations/20180418_MOE.pdf

columns.name: cv
columns.description: Coefficient of variation (CV) of the estimate. If the estimate is zero, the CV cannot be calculated and this field will be null.

columns.name: reliable
columns.description: Indicates whether the estimate is reliable based on the CV. A CV of >0.3 suggests a large amount of uncertainty around the estimate (reliable = FALSE)

columns.name: upper_ci
columns.description: Upper range of estimate with 90% confidence

columns.name: lower_ci
columns.description: Lower range of estimate with 90% confidence

columns.name: acs_table
columns.description: Name of the ACS table e.g. https://api.census.gov/data/2019/acs/acs5/variables.html

columns.name: acs_code
columns.description: Name of the ACS table code e.g. https://api.census.gov/data/2019/acs/acs5/variables.html

columns.name: acs_label
columns.description: Name of the label from the ACS table e.g. https://api.census.gov/data/2019/acs/acs5/variables.html

columns.name: acs_concept
columns.description: Concept assigned to the ACS table e.g. https://api.census.gov/data/2019/acs/acs5/variables.html

columns.name: pums_variables
columns.description: PUMS variables used for the estimate https://api.census.gov/data/2019/acs/acs1/pums/variables.html

columns.name: overall_segment
columns.description: Segment that captures the source,  year, geography, demographic category and reporting segment. This field can be used to filter the dataset. A list of all published segments can be found here:  https://data.sfgov.org/d/dmx4-ig78

columns.name: reporting_segment
columns.description: Use case or reporting need for which the estimates have been published. A list of all published reporting segments can be found here:  https://data.sfgov.org/d/kctw-xj99

columns.name: row_identifier
columns.description: Primary key and description of the data contained in the row

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp when the record (row) was last updated in the source system

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the record (row) was was last updated here (in the data portal)

whom_it_may_interest: Demographers, Economists, Policy Makers, Researchers analyzing population trends and demographics over time, Public Administration to plan resources based on demographic changes.

queries.Monthly: SELECT source, geography, demographic_category, unit, geography_name, end_year, SUM(estimate) AS estimate WHERE end_year >= start_date GROUP BY source, geography, demographic_category, unit, geography_name, end_year ORDER BY end_year
queries.Yearly: SELECT source, geography, demographic_category, unit, geography_name, end_year, SUM(estimate) AS estimate WHERE end_year >= start_date GROUP BY source, geography, demographic_category, unit, geography_name, end_year ORDER BY end_year
